get.description: Gets the site, and your user data.

post.description:
Generate a TOTP / two-factor secret.
Afterwards you need to call `/user/totp/update` with a valid token to enable it.

get.description:
Export a backup of your user settings, including your saved content,
followed communities, and blocks.

post.description: Import a backup of your user settings.

get.description: List login tokens for your user
Returns an error message if your auth token is invalid
List all the media for your user
List all the media known to your instance.

post.description:
Enable / Disable TOTP / two-factor authentication.
To enable, you need to first call `/user/totp/generate` and then pass a valid token to this.
Disabling is only possible if 2FA was previously enabled. Again it is necessary to pass a valid token.

put.description: Hide a community from public / "All" view. Admins only.

post.description: A moderator remove for a community.
Transfer your community to an existing moderator.
Ban a user from a community.
Add a moderator to your community.
A moderator remove for a post.
Hide a post from list views.
A moderator can lock a post ( IE disable new comments ).
A moderator can feature a community post ( IE stick it to the top of a community ).

get.description: Get / fetch posts, with various filters.

put.description: Resolve a post report. Only a mod can do this.

get.description: Fetch metadata for any given site.

post.description: A moderator remove for a comment.

put.description: Resolve a comment report. Only a mod can do this.

post.description: Mark a private message as read.
Create a report for a private message.

put.description: Resolve a report for a private message.

post.description: Invalidate the currently used auth token.

get.description: Get the details for a person.

post.description: Mark a person mention as read.
Ban a person from your site.

get.description: Get a list of banned users

post.description: Change your password from an email / token based reset.
Add an admin to your site.

get.description: Get the unread registration applications count.
Get the application a user submitted when they first registered their account

post.description: Purge / Delete a person from the database.
Purge / Delete a community from the database.
Purge / Delete a post from the database.
Purge / Delete a comment from the database.
Create a new oauth provider method

put.description: Edit an existing oauth provider method

post.description: Globally block an instance as admin.
Globally allow an instance as admin.
Upload an image to the server.

display_name.description: The OAuth 2.0 provider name displayed to the user on the Login page

issuer.title: The issuer url of the OAUTH provider
issuer.description: The issuer url of the OAUTH provider.

authorization_endpoint.description:
The authorization endpoint is used to interact with the resource owner and obtain an
authorization grant. This is usually provided by the OAUTH provider.

token_endpoint.description:
The token endpoint is used by the client to obtain an access token by presenting its
authorization grant or refresh token. This is usually provided by the OAUTH provider.

userinfo_endpoint.description:
The UserInfo Endpoint is an OAuth 2.0 Protected Resource that returns Claims about the
authenticated End-User. This is defined in the OIDC specification.

id_claim.description:
The OAuth 2.0 claim containing the unique user ID returned by the provider. Usually this
should be set to "sub".

client_id.description:
The client_id is provided by the OAuth 2.0 provider and is a unique identifier to this
service

scopes.description:
Lists the scopes requested from users. Users will have to grant access to the requested scope
at sign up.

auto_verify_email.description: Automatically sets email as verified on registration

account_linking_enabled.description: Allows linking an OAUTH account to an existing user account by matching emails

enabled.description: switch to enable or disable an oauth provider

use_pkce.description: switch to enable or disable PKCE

OAuthProvider.description: oauth provider with client_secret - should never be sent to the client

AuthenticateWithOauth.description: Logging in with an OAuth 2.0 authorization

federated_instances.title: Optional, because federation may be disabled
federated_instances.description: Optional, because federation may be disabled.

federation_state.description:
if federation to this instance is or was active, show state of outgoing federation to this
instance

next_retry.description: timestamp of the next retry attempt (null if fail count is 0)

last_successful_id.description: the last successfully sent activity id

fail_count.description: how many failed attempts have been made to send the next activity

last_retry.description: timestamp of the last retry attempt (when the last failing activity was resent)

community_id.description: if no community is given, it returns reports for all communities moderated by the auth user

msg.title: Is "ok" if the upload was successful; is something else otherwise
msg.description: Is "ok" if the upload was successful; is something else otherwise.

bearerAuth.description: Login from the /user/login endpoint to get a JWT token
